metadata.name: MOAB
metadata.description:
MOAB  
#1

To me, aerial imagery of desert textures isn’t just a photo, it’s a philosophy. 

A remedy to my happiness, 
a pivotal moment when the shutter clicks,  
a rush of pride fills my heart,  
my addiction to the desert textures comes alive.

I capture the moments before the sun kisses the desert, 
thousands of years of erosion,  
to create these trophy-like landscapes,  
perceiving a beauty of textures that’s never been told.

Golden and blue hour, a moment in time, 
where my art thrives. 
Beautiful moments, 
created as the light begins to fade, 
depth appears in the desert features where light is not,  
this transition of time paints the desert with soft light, 
as the direct sunlight escapes, 
color begins to explode, 
which enables my ability to create meaningful art. 

I capture with my heart, I capture with intention,  
so that my art remains forever, for all to enjoy.
